title: Mocajuba River
text:
The Mocajuba River () is a short river in the state of <a href="Par%C3%A1">Pará</a>, Brazil. It empties into the Atlantic Ocean.
Course.
The village of <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Jo%C3%A3o%20da%20Ponta">São João da Ponta</a> lies on the left bank of the river.
The Mocajuba River flows north past the <a href="Mocapajuba%20Marine%20Extractive%20Reserve">Mocapajuba Marine Extractive Reserve</a> to the west and the <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Jo%C3%A3o%20da%20Ponta%20Extractive%20Reserve">São João da Ponta Extractive Reserve</a> to the southeast and the <a href="M%C3%A3e%20Grande%20de%20Curu%C3%A7%C3%A1%20Extractive%20Reserve">Mãe Grande de Curuçá Extractive Reserve</a> to the east.
An arm of the river, the Furo Maripanema, flows northeast and joins the <a href="Curu%C3%A7%C3%A1%20River%20%28Par%C3%A1%29">Curuçá River</a>.
Environment.
Vegetation around the Rio Macajuba is almost all forest . 
The area around Rio Macajuba has low population with 19 people per square kilometre. 
The area has a monsoon climate. The average temperature is . The hottest month is July, with and the coldest month is February, at . 
The rainfall averages per year. The wettest month is March, with and the driest month is October, with .
